column4: Do I have to be connected to the Internet to use ssh? Cant i just connect via wireless card?
connect to other machine via wireless cards that is
If you can see the other machine in your network. You should use ssh with no problem.
is there a way to communicate with no internet connection?
Yes. I use ssh to communicate with my other machines in my lan.
You are connecting from A machine to B machine. Does B machine have an ssh server running on it?
Don't you have a router with dhcp ?
: yes it does
You do have the network manager...
: no router
: Just wifi cards. lappy connects via ethernet
In network manager you should be able to create a wireless network in one of the computers.
I do not understand your network setup. Can you ellaborate on that?
: Yes, my lappy is in the kitchen connected via ethernet, Desktop in the living room with a wifi card usb connected and im trying to connect to it to transfer files
Lappy connects via ethernet to ROUTERA. And Desktop connects to ROUTERA too.     Is that your setup  ?

yes, would adhoc work?
You can create a new wireless network on Desktop. Network icon -> Create a new wireless network
